name: Vinoperfect Radiance Serum Vitamin C Alternative
about: What it is:A highly concentrated, oil-free serum that visibly evens skin tone for a brighter complexion—with 62X more powerful results than vitamin C..Skin Type:Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily.Skincare Concerns:Dark Spots, Dullness, and Uneven Texture.Formulation:Lightweight Serum.Highlighted Ingredients:- Patented Vine Sap Viniferine: Is 62X more effective at visibly brightening, diminishing dark spots, and evening skin tone than vitamin C..Ingredient Callouts:Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan, and contains less than one percent synthetic fragrance. It is also gluten-free, cruelty-free, and comes in recyclable packaging..What Else You Need to Know:Formulated with a sun-safe alternative to vitamin C, this serum is shown to reduce the appearance of dark spots after just one bottle. It’s effective on all visible discolorations (like sunspots, acne spots, hyperpigmentation, and melasma) and suits all skin tones and types, including sensitive skin..Clinical Results:In a clinical study, with dermatological scoring on dark-spot coloration, on 65 volunteers, after 56 days:
ingredients: -Patented Vine Sap Viniferine: Is 62X more effective at visibly brightening, diminishing dark spots, and evening skin tone than vitamin C..-Olive Squalane: Provides nongreasy moisture..-Biomimetic Emulsifier: Enhances Viniferine’s visibly brightening efficacy...Aqua/Water/Eau, Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Coco-Caprylate/Caprate, Squalane, Palmitoyl Grapevine Shoot Extract, Polyglyceryl-3 Distearate, Bisabolol, Glyceryl Stearate, Xanthan Gum, Caprylyl Glycol, Microcrystalline Cellulose, Polyacrylate Crosspolymer-6, Potassium Sorbate, Glyceryl Stearate Citrate, Citric Acid, Sodium Phytate, Sodium Hydroxide, Parfum (Fragrance)...The list of ingredients is subject to change, please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Apply to your face, neck, and décolleté, AM and PM..-Follow with Vinoperfect Instant Brightening Moisturizer with Niacinamide (sold separately) for optimal results...Recycling Instructions:.-Recycle bottle curbside..-Recycle dropper through TerraCycle®.

reviews.review_text: I have been using this serum for about a month and have noticed a huge difference in my skin. However, this is now a staple in my routine, and I can't imagine myself not using it.

reviews.review_title: Hoping it will fade dark spots. 4th product tried.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love how this applies in quite small drops. It takes very little to cover the face; 1 for forehead, 1 for each cheek, 1 for chin, and 1-2 for décolletage. It feels like you put nothing on. It’s not oily or sticky. It has no smell which is good. I can’t tell yet if it lightens dark spots. I’m 72 and spent far too many years laying out in the sun, many years without sunscreen. Don’t do that. I have some very dark spots. I’ve used 3 other products over the last 15 years, twice a day, and none worked. The others varied in cost (Clinique, Estée Lauder, Lancôme). This ties with Estée Lauder Night Repair. None of those did a thing with 3-5 years of using each 2x a day consistently. We’ll see if this helps. For the price, I’ll try 3 bottles.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, red hair, fairLight skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: My dad gave me this brand new, but only used one bottle when he bought it and did not like it personally. He said it was too runny, but he just didn’t know how to  use this type of formulation. Take the time to really rub this into your skin one zone at a time. You will notice that layers of dead skin will start coming off as you rub in the serum. It doesn’t sting or hurt or anything. It’s really awesome to see a Sarah that works, and you can literally feel part of your face that haven’t been touched yet versus parts of the face that have already been touched as you work, the salmon.  Like I said, I’ll never use another serum again and I recommend it to absolutely everyone!  I hope this is helpful. :-)

reviews.review_title: Not A Fit For My Sensitive Skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received the Caudalie Vinoperfect Radiance Dark Spot Serum Vitamin C Alternative in exchange for my review. I have tried other products from this line and something about the ingredients is not a good fit for my dry and sensitive skin. I experienced small white bumps, redness, and irritation so I discontinued using the product. Since my skin couldn’t tolerate the serum, I can’t speak to any benefits in terms of lightening dark spots. Here is the most up to date ingredient list: Aqua/Water/Eau, Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Coco-Caprylate/Caprate, Squalane, Palmitoyl Grapevine Shoot Extract, Polyglyceryl-3 Distearate, Bisabolol, Glyceryl Stearate, Xanthan Gum, Caprylyl Glycol, Microcrystalline Cellulose, Polyacrylate Crosspolymer-6, Potassium Sorbate, Glyceryl Stearate Citrate, Citric Acid, Sodium Phytate, Sodium Hydroxide, Parfum (Fragrance).(243/032). I do have sensitivities to many fruits and vegetables (eating and some from handling) so I’m not sure if it’s the vine sap or the fragrance or one of the other ingredients that bothered my skin. If you typically do well with fragrance in skincare, this might be an option for you to try if you haven’t seen results from other types of Vitamin C serums. I personally think there are more affordable and effective products available and so I would not personally recommend this serum.

reviews.review_text: Both me and my twin got this product. My skin is combination and hers is mostly oily. I had maybe 2-3 old dark pimple blemishes from pregnancy break out and she had a few more. We both started using our bottles the same day and used religiously for 2 weeks before reviewing. Her dark spots started clearing up after only a week of use, while mine remained the same. We do have separate diets, daily routines, as well as different skin care regimens, which is to be considered.  That said, I do believe this product works, it clearly did for my twin sister. I will continue to add it to my regimen and maybe up my water intake to aid the process along.  I received this product for free from Topbox Marketing for testing and review purposes.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I don't write review's very often, but I have to write one for this product. I have struggled with dark, red spots caused by hormonal and cystic acne - meaning, those deep pimples that don't scar, but the redness and color doesn't go away. I have used this serum for A WEEK, and already these dark spots have FADED. And I mean, FADED. I am THRILLED with this product, and it will be a regular in my routine forever. I love anything by Caudalie but this stuff is magic.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I hate that I love this so much. That price for 30ml?!  But say goodbye to dark spots and hyperpigmentation.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Vinoperfect Brightening Dark Spot Serum is an effective natural solution for dark spots. I have been dealing with dark spots since my pregnancy, and they worsened with sun exposure. I tried various products to treat them, including a combination of Hydroquinone and Tretinoin cream, which was harsh on my skin. Seeking a more natural approach, I integrated the Vinoperfect spot remover alongside Tretinoin, and it has worked wonders. I noticed a slight improvement within the first week and after almost a month, the results are comparable to the strong prescription treatment with Hydroquinone. The only drawback of this product is its distinct smell, though not unbearable. Consistency is key, but when incorporated into a solid morning and evening skincare routine, it is a valuable addition. I received this product as a gift in exchange for my honest review.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I'm thrilled with Caudalie's Vinoperfect Brightening Dark Spot Serum! It's oil-free, vegan, and has transformed my skin. The lightweight formula absorbs beautifully, visibly reducing dark spots and improving my complexion. Clinical results show a 63% reduction in dark spots after just one bottle. Plus, it's suitable for all skin tones. I appreciate Caudalie's commitment to sustainability with recyclable packaging. Overall, I highly recommend this serum for anyone struggling with dark spots or uneven skin tone.

reviews.review_title: The science is there: This serum works!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, red hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I am a fair-skinned redhead with freckles, but despite slathering on sunscreen my entire life and always wearing a cap or visor, I've developed a few bigger brown spots on the top of my cheek due to a lifetime of playing tennis and biking. I can cover them with concealer and a BB Cream, but I wanted to finally go to the source. I started using this serum before Caudalie's regular anti-aging cream moisturizer and the results in just a month have been dramatic. We love you, Sephora, but word to the wise: You can find all of Caudalie's products on your next trip to France for half the price. As getting to Paris is not a yearly option for me or for most people, I'm very happy to see that Caudulie US and Sephora also carry the refill versions of the regular moisturizer. I just picked one up on a birthday trip to Paris with my husband (a big birthday). I also talked with a Caudalie representative while in Paris who explained the clinical studies they did to develop the serum and cream. She won me over!

reviews.review_title: A nice serum that has improved my skin!!!

reviews.review_text: I've been using this Caudalie Vinoperfect serum for about few weeks now, and it's worth the hype  It's a nice serum that has improved my skin!!!. After about a week's use, I noticed my face, neck and chest were much smoother and softer, my skin just loved this serum. By the second week I started to notice an increase in dark spots and hyperpigmentation and became skeptical. I almost stopped using it. It was like the serum was bringing to the surface every blemish I'd ever had on my face. But I decided to stick with it. And I'm glad I did. By the third week, the spots started to decrease and now, at week four, they are starting to lighten noticeably. It's also evened out my complexion and I dont have to wear foundation. I have fewer bumps and blackheads. My skin seems to glow from within. I use the Caudalie serum once a day at night and an illuminating, hydrating serum from another brand during the day. I've read reviews that the Caudalie serum gives people acne. I have rosacea and super sensitive skin, and it doesnt irritate my skin whatsoever, or cause me to break out, even with the light aloe scent. I'm in my 30s so my skin is less oily and more dry than it used to be. It might not suit someone with acne-prone skin. I received this product for free from Topbox Marketing for testing and review purposes.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: 'Viniferine' is sixty-two (!!) times more powerful than Vitamin C, according to the packaging! I've not heard of it, or come across it in any other brand before, but it must be potent, because it's almost completely faded a post-acne scar on my chin and it did this alone in under 2 weeks. I state alone because there's barely anything else in this product that could've done it, other than Vitamin E. It's a quite basic and somewhat short, uninspiring ingredients list. Worth noting is that it contains fragrance...far too much of it! Also a fair number of chemicals which I didn't expect in a 'natural' brand, Sodium Hydroxide being one of them. The serum itself is a light milky fluid that you only need 2-3 drops of to cover your face & neck. It sinks in easily and it hydrates too, although you will need to follow up with a moisturizer. I also find it has a nice brightening effect which builds up gradually as you keep using it. The downside is that after nearly 2 weeks of diligent use, this started to break me out so I had to stop using it completely. My guess? Either the fragrance or Glyceryl Stearate SE - a mildly acnegenic ingredient. If you're not sensitive to fragrance or acne prone, this may be worth giving a try, although you can pick up other products with a similarly high Vit E content (plus other beneficial ingredients) for a fraction of this one.   ~ My Sephora Top 7 must-have list ~  (My top 7 must-have beauty products of all time, focusing mainly on my purchases at Sephora)  1. Hair Loss Treatment: ‘Divine Herbal’ - Hair Oil  2. Shampoo: 'Sephora Collection' - Deep Cleaning Shampoo 3. Face Mask: ‘Peter Thomas Roth’ – Pumpkin Enzyme Mask  4. Pigmentation + Anti-Aging Serum: ‘Divine Herbal’ - Facial Treatment Serum 5. Face Scrub: ‘Sisley' - Botanical Gentle Buffing Cream 6. Lip Balm: ‘Nuxe’ – Reve De Miel Lip Balm 7. Lip Liner: ‘Sephora Collection' - Rouge Gel Lip Liner

reviews.review_buyer_description: Gray eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was going through a phase of hormonal breakouts, which included cystic acne that was leading to scarring. After some research, I decided to give this product a try. I paired it with Caudalie’s Vinopure oil-control moisturizer, and Vinopure purifying gel cleanser in hopes of helping prevent some newer acne from popping up. I’ve been using this product once or twice a day- mainly at night. The more fresh scars faded very quickly. The older, deeper scars are taking longer to fade. Overall, there is a noticeable difference in the scarring within 2 weeks of use. Before I bought this product, I was feeling very insecure of my face every time I was leaving the house. This product has helped me feel like myself again. I’m looking forward to seeing how it continues to perform!  The only con for me, is that I don’t enjoy the smell. The results I have received help me to look past that though.

reviews.review_title: Amazing at fading spots but too expensive
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is an absolute amazing product. It literally fades acne scars and dark spots in a couple weeks. The only reason I took a star off is because it’s $100 which I think is a little ridiculous.

reviews.review_title: this is a no for me!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: a definite no. first, this product is very expensive and u only receive a small bottle. it has a weird smell that i did not enjoy. it made my skin look oily and also broke me out! i’ve used better and cheaper products that have actually improved my skin. try using products from the ordinary before going for this!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Was eyeing this serum for so long, and finally decided to purchase, to see if it would help. It smells like something from a luxurious spa and does leave a glow. However, I did not notice a significant long term difference when using this.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Love the way my blemishes are disappearing definitely something you have to stay consistent with if you want to see results! If you’re not a consistent person I wouldn’t recommend jus because I realize I notice much more results with consistency

reviews.review_title: Great serum, love that it’s clean as well
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: First time serum user here and did some initial research and landed on this one! So glad I did, a little goes a long way, it’s definitely hydrating and brightening and it has a subtle smell that fades. Helps so much with my pregnancy acne and dark spots! Definitely recommend and love that it’s “cleaner” than most products out there.

reviews.review_title: The best dark spot corrector EVER
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Definitely cleared up a lot of acne scars that I have caused myself. If you buy this and think spots will go away right within a week, then you’re wrong. It takes daily use and after two months of using this, I can see the difference in my skin. Even my husband noticed the difference. Will definitely be purchasing this over and over again.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I bought this hoping it would help fade my dark spots and acne scars as I’ve used tons of different vitamin c’s and haven’t seen huge results. I took before photos so I could gauge if it was actually working and took photos today after one month to compare. OH MY GOD- I hadn’t realized how much better my skin looks until I compared but it is night and day. I’ve been using this every morning after my cleanser and occasionally some cerave acne spot treatment gel and I’m so happy with the result. I bought this serum on sale but will happily pay full price if it can keep fading my spots away. So sorry for those with a bad reaction! I don’t use any actives with this in my morning routine, I’m curious if it doesn’t mix well with other actives.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, gray hair, Porcelain skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Not sure about the anti-aging properties long term, but this serum leaves my skin supple and glowy, and my makeup lays super nicely on it. On top of all that, it smells lovely! I have extremely sensitive skin (rosacea, acne-prone, dry) and have used this consistently for a year and a half - on my third bottle I think. I pair it with Bobbi brown face base or glossier moisturizer for daytime and I use the purple caudelie at night, my skin has never been happier! In my opinion, it’s worth every penny, though I can’t speak to long term effects on dark spots.

My acne scars are fading, and I’ve tried so many products to try to get them to fade but nothing ever worked, besides this. The change isn’t drastic, but I can say that it definitely works, just takes quite a bit of time. My only complaint is the price. So expensive but worth it if you want to even out your complexion.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This product changed my life! I had a lot of dark spots and acne scars and this product helped me a lot to get rid of them.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Lately, I've been struggling with some dark spots due to picking at my skin. And I wanted to find something to help clear that up. I've been using this every morning and night straight for about two weeks, and I've already seen such good improvement! It's definitely helped even out my skin, and the dark spots are almost gone. There is no fragrance, and it feels really nice on the skin. It doesn't feel tacky or sticky at all like some serums do.   I pair this serum with the Youth to the People Superberry hydrate + glow dream oil, and the Youth to the people adaptogen deep moisturizer cream.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: My skin couldn’t handle ANY conventional vitamin C serums (l-ascorbic acid versions). I wanted help with hyperpigmentation & acne scars so I tried this from a rewards bazaar sample. Fell in love!!! After a few weeks I noticed a difference in overall skin tone and clarity so on my first trip to France I went to their pharmacie and scored a huge bottle at nearly half the cost from retailers in the US. Caudalie is of course a French brand so obviously it’s cheaper there. Regardless I’ll continue to repurchase here because it is soothing and effective and a great alternative to more acidic vitamin C serums.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I’ve been using this product since June when I got it and it’s honestly the best brightened serum out there! It’s helped me heal my acne scars so much and people always compliment my skin now! It also smells so good! comedogenic

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: this product has helped me so much with boosting my confidence! just from using a mini i have seen beautiful results in my skin with an even tone, and having a closer appearance to glass skin!

reviews.review_title: A must have in your skincare.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This product have helped me a lot, it’s was the money. It did work for me miracle it’s something I will always have on my skincare products Thank you caudalie for being my miracle.

reviews.review_title: I will never be without these!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, gray hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: So I damaged my skin barrier really bad from pure vitamin C (L-Ascorbic). I just started using it not realizing there were different formulas, strengths, etc. and my skin went crazy. At first I thought it was the tretinoin I started using, which may have added to the irritation. So I stopped, did some research and decided to try this. I use this, along with their Glycolic Essence, and the Vinoperfect moisturizer. I also use Image MD vitamin C, which is tetrahedral ascorbic vitamin c that has a neutral pH and I use Faded Topicals. Yes, I know it’s a lot but it’s working for me and my pores are no longer clogged. I still get an occasional pimple which you can see in one of the pics on my chin but I think it came from something else I tried to add into my skincare. So I’ve finally found something that works. As you can see in the pics the difference in only 2-3 weeks . I’ve only been using Faded for a week but the Caudalie and Vitamin C I’ve been using for about 2-3 weeks. I’m very satisfied. These will always be in my rotation. Give it time, it does work. I don’t have acne prone skin but it is oily and I do get occasional pimples but nothing to bad. This really works for me. Can’t wait to get my smooth skin back again 😊

reviews.review_title: Not worth $80 but an okay product
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I do think this product is expensive but I like the quality and it feels nice on my face. I don't personally have a lot of dark spots but my fav. part about it was the like nice milky feeling. I don't think it is worth around $80 but if you have money laying around, it is a good get.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: It feels really nice on the skin but is it just me that doesn’t like the scent ?

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I usually don't write reviews but wanted to give a fair warning to whoever is considering buying. Received a mini/sample size and was excited to try. I was a bit skeptical after looking at the reviews warning about bad reactions or breakouts from it but had never reacted badly to serums/creams in the past so thought it would be fine. I used twice, AM and PM and the next day woke up with the start of a MAJOR cystic acne breakout. I haven't had acne like that in over 5 years and it took weeks to fully recover from. Really seems like theres something in this product that can be volatile for some people. I personally would advise to reconsider and decide if its worth the risk if you haven't used before.

reviews.review_text: Great texture, minimal smell— but didn’t see any improvement in dark spots or general texture, unfortunately. I used the entire bottle before writing this review so I could be sure.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Tried this twice a day after finishing my last vitamin c serum and was curious to see if it would be as effective on my late-30’s sensitive skin… it wasn’t. Two weeks into the bottle I feel like I’ve lost a lot of the progress I made with my vitamin c serum. My fine lines are back, my skin looks less plump, less even and less bright. That doesn’t mean it’s a bad product per se, but it does mean that it doesn’t target the same spectrum of issues as vitamin c so it shouldn’t be advertised as a vitamin c alternative. It only claims to brighten skin and fade spots, vitamin c does more than that. I’m debating whether to finish the bottle or toss it… on top of not being as effective for my needs, I struggle with the smell. I think it smells like cheap, harsh hotel soap. I don’t enjoy applying it. I will not repurchase this and won’t recommend it to anyone who has anti-aging skin concerns to contend with.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I actually really like this serum, I used it all throughout 2020 and it really helped with post acne spots. Please be advised you must wear sunscreen when using this, as it would probably worsen without sunscreen.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: All time favorite serum!!! Repurchased so many times and remains my fave!! Def worth the money!

The serum goes on smoothly, smells nice, and feels moisturizing but that’s about it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: veryyy pricey but so worth it. i saw results in the first week of using this product and i instantly fell in love with it. it does have a slight fragrance, but not too heavy which i like. great brand overall!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I really love this product. I wanted to add a vitamin c to my routine after my mother suggested it. I’ve been using a retinoid for a while and that got my acne under control but I still had stubborn hyperpigmentation and texture. I chose this because I wanted to use an alternative vitamin c that performed well with my retinoid. It says to use it twice a day but I only use it once a day, in the morning, before moisturizer and sunscreen. Obviously with that level of usage you don’t see results as quickly but after my first bottle I noticed improvement in my hyperpigmentation. I feel more glowy and even and I feel like if I do breakout my dark spots go away faster than before I started using this serum. I’m on my fourth bottle and I actually just bought the jumbo size through the Caudalie site so hopefully that cuts down on how many bottles I go through. I took off one star because of the price/size. I know this price is typical but it’s definitely something I recommend cautiously because everyone’s budget is different.

Maybe if you have lighter spots this would work?? But the biossance serum is cheaper and it worked so much better on my skin!! reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I've been a bit hesitant to try this out on my skin. At first, I was really excited to receive something so nice with a heavy glass bottle. It felt expensive. I did a spot test on my neck and everything went fine. (I have had reactions to skincare in the past.) But then I saw it had Parfum/Fragrance. An undisclosed synthetic fragrance. I'm just not interested in using this on my face for that reason which is such a shame.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: #freeproduct #trywithtopbox - Overall, this product seemed to help with dark spots, but not enough to justify the price.  I’ve always struggled with acne-related hyperpigmentation.  I regularly use some combination of a vitamin C lotion, micro-needling pen, at-home chemical peels, retin-A, etc. to address the problem and yet still routinely have dark spots long after a breakout is gone.  Alas, this didn’t end up being the miracle product to replace them all.  I typically use Caudalie’s Vinoperfect Radiance Dark Spot Serum either on top of my toner for everyday wear, or right after micro-needling or peeling to help maximize its absorption.  My skin does overall seem more even in tone, but my acne itself has also improved lately, so there’s less hyperpigmentation being created.  For large dark spots, there doesn’t seem to have been any difference—the spots fade, but not noticeably faster since I’ve been using this product versus my usual products/routines.  That said, I’ve not had any particularly negative experiences or issues with the product.  It makes my face a bit shinier than I would like, but I usually don’t care.  One full dropper is plenty to cover my face/neck, and it’s neither sticky nor greasy.  Smells odd—like it’s just a mixture of random compounds with zero fragrance added—but the smell doesn’t linger so I don’t mind that it’s not a particularly nice smell.  Didn’t have any issues with irritation or anything.  All in, I’d say this serum is just ok, so I definitely can’t recommend it at an $82 price point.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I received this serum as a #freeproduct and it is now a holy grail item. I’ve had stubborn dark spots from my acne which was exacerbated during my pregnancy. I used this serum daily in the morning for about a month and noticed a big improvement in the texture and even tone in my skin. Some of my most stubborn spots are finally healing after having had them for several months. I love that this serum isn’t as sun sensitive as most vitamin C serums. It also feels very lightweight on my skin and not sticky. I definitely plan on stocking up!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received this item for free from TopBox for my honest review. I have enjoyed using this serum and I feel it has given my skin a nice glow. I have dark spots from old acne scars and after a few weeks of use I can tell they have lightened.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I had high expectation for this serum. My skin burns terribly after using this product. Despite wearing sunscreen every day, I see more burning and prominent hyperpigmentation after using this product. If you have sensitive skin, stay away from this product.

reviews.review_title: Visible improvement in only a couple weeks!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received this #freeproduct for my honest review. I'm happy to report that after only a few short weeks, I have seen improvement in dark spots and sun damage on my chest from using the Vinoperfect Radiance Dark Spot Serum only once per day. My sensitive skin had no negative reactions whatsoever. The serum absorbs quickly, and doesn't feel sticky or greasy at all. It has a scent that I would describe as more earthy than floral, and while I have a tendency to be scent-sensitive, this one doesn't bother me at all. I will continue to use and hope to see additional improvement. I would definitely recommend to anyone looking to improve to look of discoloration caused by sun damage.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Caudalie Vinoperfect Radiance Dark Spot Serum is by far the best facial serum I have used to date. It has significantly faded my darkspots and gave my dull skin the glow it needed. It absorbs fast into my skin without being greasy. This product is a miracle worker,  that's for sure !

reviews.review_text: This vegan serum promises to brighten dark spots with viniferine, and olive squalane for hydration. It has a pleasant but strong luxurious fragrance. I used it every night for the past few weeks on damp skin, and followed by a basic moisturizer. In terms of moisturization, it does what it promises. I have a bit of hyperpigmentation from acne, and didn't notice major improvements to them. #freeproduct

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have been using the Caudalie Vinoperfect Radiance Dark Spot Serum for the past few months. It has a really nice and thick glass bottle. The dropper dispenses the perfect amount needed for an application. It feels really nice and is not heavy. It has given my skin a very radiant and hydrated look after continuously using. It did give a glow to my dry face. I deal with dark spots / malasma and my skin was pretty clear when I started using this. After 2 weeks, dark spots started coming back. Which was such a disappointment. I was hoping that it would clear, but it just seemed to get worse as time went on. I think this product is way too expensive and overhyped. If it did what it claims to do, I could maybe look past the high price tag.  #freeproduct

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I like that a little bit of this serum goes a long way. It is a watery consistency and is very thin, but that doesn't bother me. After that, I began to forget to use it when I was supposed to so applications have been a bit more sparse. During the time I used it like I was supposed to, i did begin to see results with my old dark acne scars. They have faded somewhat but not completely. Hopefully, with continued use, they will completely disappear. My new scars don't seem to be fading yet. I like this serum, but would not pay the $82 for it. I am grateful to have had the opportunity to try it though. #freeproduct

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I think this is a beautiful serum, just not for me. It is really creamy for a serum, which makes it feel so moisturizing, emollient, and luxurious on the skin. It sinks in pretty quickly and leaves a healthy looking glow to your face. However, the fragrance is SO strong. I prefer my skincare to at least be free of artificial fragrance, and this is definitely not. The floral scent, while nice, is overwhelming to me and gives me a headache. It also doesn’t dissipate. You’re just stuck with a perfumed face for hours. It really ruined this serum for me. If there were a fragrance free version, it would be a truly lovely product, but as it stands, I can’t use it anymore and wouldn’t recommend it if you don’t like scented products. However, if the scent doesn't bother you, I can see how people love this stuff! #freeproduct

reviews.review_text: I received this from @Topboxcircle in exchange for my honest review.This is honestly one of the best brightening serums I've ever used! I have sensitive combo skin and this works perfectly for me, it's not oily or drying and it's very gentle it doesn't irritate my skin. I have a few acne marks and I noticed some major fading in their appearance after using this serum for a couple of weeks. It does have a scent but I don't mind it and it fades away after rubbing in the serum. I'm really pleased with this product and will definitely be using it in my daily routine from now on. I can't wait to tell my friend's and family about it. I would recommend it to anyone.

reviews.review_text: I've been using this serum every morning for about a month now, and am definitely seeing results! I use it after washing my face and before sunscreen, and it doesn't pill on the occasions that I wear makeup. I was skeptical of whether or not this was going to work, and. can say it has transformed my skin, and I have a much more even skin tone!   It's not going to work miracles, but as someone who has been on a journey with their skin for 15 years it's been that final product that has me feeling like I have good skin. I've struggled with acne, and extremely oily skin and can still have acne flare ups, but it's finally at a manageable point. I do have some acne scarring and while this hasn't made them go away completely, it's given my skin an even tone -- something I haven't had in years without foundation.   I know the price is jarring, but I think it's worth at least one bottle to give it a try.

reviews.review_title: a gentle yet effective solution to dark spots and
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Caudalie Vinoperfect Radiance Dark Spot Serum is a popular skincare product designed to address hyperpigmentation and dark spots on the skin. It contains a combination of natural ingredients, including vine sap-derived Viniferine, which is known to be effective in reducing the appearance of dark spots and improving skin radiance.  After using this serum for several weeks, I noticed a significant improvement in the overall appearance of my skin. The dark spots on my face were visibly reduced, and my skin appeared brighter and more even-toned. The serum is lightweight and absorbs quickly, leaving my skin feeling hydrated and refreshed.  One of the things I appreciate about this product is that it is free from harmful ingredients such as parabens, sulfates, and phthalates. It is also vegan and cruelty-free, which is a huge plus for me.  Overall, I would highly recommend Caudalie Vinoperfect Radiance Dark Spot Serum to anyone looking for a gentle yet effective solution to dark spots and hyperpigmentation. It is a great addition to any skincare routine and can help you achieve a more radiant, even-toned complexion.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received a #freeproduct sample in return for my honest opinion.  I have previously suffered from melasma and it had gotten pretty bad.  I had a lot of hyperpigmentation on my cheeks, forehead and along my jawline.  I had to use some pretty harsh prescription products to lighten my skin.   I used it as long as I could but these products are too harsh for my skin for daily use.  Most of my really bad melasma has diminished but I still have some residual spots.  I have been using the Caudalie Vinoperfect twice a day for a few weeks now and while it has not completely taken away my stubborn discoloration, I have noticed that my skin is more even toned, and looks healthier.  This product does not irritate my skin at all, is not sticky, absorbs quickly and I had no problem applying makeup afterwards in the morning.  I like the subtle glow it leaves after application.  Overall, I am very pleased with how my skin looks and I will continue daily use of this product.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brunette hair, Medium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Caudalíe Paris is the definition of a prestige brand who never fails to blow me away when it comes to results. This complexion correcting radiance serum delivers exactly what it promises within a matter of days and is a joyous experience to use. The packaging is heavy frosted glass, just transparent enough to see through, but opaque to protect the magic inside. It's easy to dispense a drop or two from the curve-tipped glass dropper, which is all you need to cover your whole face. The milky serum is ideal for patting into your face, neck and décolleté and doesn't feel sticky or heavy when preparing the skin for moisturizer afterwards. It has a light fragrance that I find extremely pleasant. I look forward to smelling it each time I do my skincare routine. I am 35 years old and have lived an active life with too much sun exposure and not enough protection at times so I've developed some dark spots. I've tried so many products that promised to reduce the appearance of dark spots and some have helped, but since I started using this Vinoperfect serum from Caudalíe, I see a difference every morning when I look in the mirror. I cannot wait to see how far it can take me and I plan to purchase more from this line. I don't think I've ever used such a perfect product!

reviews.review_title: An Amazing Alternative to Vitamin C
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Loving this product! I have tried LITERALLY every Vitamin C product available - whether it's in a cream/liquid/serum or it's mixed with other vitamins/on it's own or 10% or 2% - I have never found a Vitamin C product that my skin tolerates. I have been left with burns or I have very bad, painful breakouts. I have been looking for an alternative serum and have absolutely settled on this one and have repurchased multiple times now. When I have breakouts, I tend to be left with dark marks on my face. I have noticed this product has absolutely improved these dark marks over time, and helps to give my skin a subtle, healthy glow every morning. I only wash my face with a face wash at night, and in the morning use only water to rinse my face. After rinsing with water I apply this product and wait 5-10 minutes before moving on to the next step in my routine. Consistency is key for this serum (like any product), and I have followed this routine daily for the last 8-9 months or so. I've never had a breakout from this product even with acne prone skin, and I've found it has helped improve my overall skin texture as well. I wear makeup daily and have never had any issues or pilling since adding this to my routine as it is a very light, almost milk texture that absorbs into the skin no problem. If you are someone who doesn't tolerate Vitamin C and are looking for an alternative to help lighten dark spots, improve skin texture, and help keep your skin glowing and healthy, I would absolutely recommend this product!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I didn't see results immediately at first. However, I have continued to use it now that it has gotten colder and it is my favorite. My skills feels radiant and it has faded old acne scars. I will most likely use this during the cold months and then use a vitamin c serum during warmer months. I only apply this in the morning with moisturizer and sunscreen and have seen a big difference.

reviews.review_text: I had gone for my very first facial back in June and the aesthetician used this on my face for redness that she had noticed.  You use it before applying moisturizer.  Currently I am using the Tatcha Water Cream.  A little does go a long way with both products, so even though it is pricey, I still have a little over half the Caudalie bottle left and I'm going on almost two months now.  I just ran out of the Tatcha so I'll be picking that up soon.  I'll admit I can skimp on my skin routine too either because I am too tired or just forget (I work from home so I don't wear makeup as often as I used to) so that might also be why it lasted longer.  But again, you don't have to use huge globs to get good coverage.

reviews.review_text: I. LOVE. THIS.  Nothing has worked for my dark spots. With melanated skin I thought you would need something potent. It may be pricey but it works well for me and I'm definitely restocking when I'm out! I have oily skin and this absorbs quickly and doesn't make my skin feel oily, clogged, or heavy. I love it!

reviews.review_title: not for sensitive or acne prone skin!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This product was being raved about all of the internet so I decided to take my chances. I have dark spots and scarring from bad acne and was hoping it would help speed up the process to brighten them up. Nope. Clogged my pores and caused horrible breakouts in areas that I’ve never had acne before. I’m talking about painful acne did took forever to heal. It was the only new thing I’ve introduced to my skin and I used it consistently for weeks? I didn’t want to believe that this product was what was destroying my skin but it did. The fragrance in this was so strong too, so this is not for sensitive skin or acne prone individuals.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I came here to write a rave review, but was shocked to learn this is a dark spot serum!? I was recommended this product by a sephora rep who also has bad dry skin like me. OMG it is SO GOOD! I have horrible dry skin, especially in the winter. This serum helped me FLAWLESSLY SURVIVE BOSTON WINTER this past year! I will say, I use several drops each use and therefore the bottle only lasts me about 1.5-2months, but personally, the money spent is worth it because I have never found a product that kept my skin so hydrated as this one. ...and I am still going to buy 2 more right now, even after learning its main focus isnt hydration!? Its taken me years to accomplish some form of survival with my dry skin on my face. Using oil based makeup remover plus a milky cleaner and then THIS serum, all at night, has been a life changer for me. I also really love The Ordinary Marine Hylaronics! I will also periodically pair with different face masks before bed, but more often than not a cheaper hydrating sheet mask from amazon suffices. Again, i use 2-4 drops of this on my face by pressing all over. I often do 1-2 more drops in the morning before makeup. Sale rep who initially introduced me to this said product should last 6 months-- that is nowhere the case for me, but the extra drops/running out before a 2 month mark, is my survival goal, so! (Also- a good primer, beauty blender and MAC's water weight foundation also really help my dry skin during/after makeup application this past winter.)

reviews.review_text: I received this #freeproduct from #trywithtopbox (Top Box Circle) in exchange for my honest review. Firstly, some background I researched on the product. This company was started in 1995 by a husband and wife from France who believed that their vineyard (grapes) contained the secret to amazing skincare. So all of their products have grapes in them. Their products are safe for pregnant women and people with acne-prone skin, and their packaging is 100% recyclable. After reading all of this, before even trying the products, I was already in love with the brand. The Vinoperfect Radiance Serum claims to target dark spots, dull skin, and uneven skin tone and make it more even and radiant. I used this product in the morning for a little over a week and noticed a visible difference in the natural glow my skin had. It now had one! I also noticed that this product dried down a teensy bit tacky so that gave me an idea. I used it in place of my primer one day and my makeup looked flawless. This product is amazing. A little on the pricy side but so very worth it!

I received this Vino perfect Radiance Dark Spot Serum as a #freeproduct from #trywithtopbox and I must say I'm highly impressed. I use this serum in the morning before my moisturizer and SPF and at night before the glycolic brightening cream and I can see an improvement in my skin tone. It's more even and bright. reviews.review_text: This is my first time trying this brand and I love it. The serum comes in sturdy glass bottle and is white in color. The dropper design is nice to get product in right amount. I have oily/combination skin and did not find any heavy or sticky feeling after applying. It did cause redness and irritation around my nose area after applying so I avoid using it in that area and results are good. It gives matte look to skin without overdrying it. Skin looks clean and even after use. I would recommend it to all and really happy to have tried this.

I have some concerning dark spots around my face, mainly my cheek and eye area, so I am hoping to see results with more continued use, but even in this short time my skin feels softer, with a texture that’s smooth and brighter. #freeproduct #trywithtopbox
